summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (P6541.02) establishing procedures for inmate access to Over-the-Counter (OTC) medications. It details how inmates can purchase OTC medications from the commissary or obtain them for free if indigent, and outlines the roles of Health Services staff and the commissary committee. The document is a policy manual and contains no specific information about Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any individuals involved with him.
keyFacts: This is a generic Bureau of Prisons policy document (Program Statement P6541.02) dated November 17, 2004.
The policy establishes procedures for federal inmates to access Over-the-Counter (OTC) medications via commissary purchase or free provision if indigent.
An 'inmate without funds' is defined as one who has not had a trust fund account balance of $6.00 for the past 30 days.
The document rescinds a prior version of the policy (P6541.01) from September 10, 2003.
The document contains no references to Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, victims, or any events related to his case.
